hero.title: Family Reunification in Sweden
hero.subtitle: Comprehensive Guide Under Swedish National Law

intro.heading: Bring Your Family to Sweden
intro.description: Sweden's family reunification laws allow individuals holding various types of residence permits—including work permits, business permits, PhD and student permits, and permanent residence permits—as well as refugees, to bring family members to Sweden. Each case type has specific requirements and is assessed under different provisions of Swedish national law.
intro.infoBox: Navigate complex family reunification requirements with expert knowledge of Swedish national law and specific permit type assessments.

familyReunification.lawsHeading: Key Swedish Laws Governing Family Reunification

laws.name: Aliens Act (Utlänningslagen)
laws.description: The main legislation governing residence permits and family reunification for all non-Swedish citizens.

laws.name: Temporary Aliens Act (Tillfälliga Utlänningslagen)
laws.description: A temporary law affecting family reunification requirements, primarily for refugees and individuals needing subsidiary protection.

laws.name: Swedish Nationality Act (Lag om Svenskt Medborgarskap)
laws.description: Relevant for Swedish citizens and permanent residents inviting family members.

laws.name: Social Insurance Code (Socialförsäkringsbalken)
laws.description: Provides guidelines on acceptable income sources for the maintenance requirement.

eligibility.heading: Who Can Be Sponsored?
eligibility.description: Family reunification is generally available to eligible family members under Swedish law. Each relationship type has specific eligibility criteria.

familyMembers.description: Long-term, unregistered partners may qualify if the relationship is well-documented
Minor children of the permit holder or their spouse/partner
For permit holders under 18, parents or legal guardians may be eligible
Other family members may be considered for humanitarian reasons

requirements.heading: Maintenance and Housing Requirements
requirements.description: The Maintenance Requirement (Försörjningskrav) is essential for most family reunification applications, ensuring the primary applicant has sufficient income and suitable housing to support family members.
maintenance: Stable income to cover living expenses
Employment contracts or proof of self-employment
Recent pay slips and tax returns
housing: Rental agreement or proof of ownership
Sufficient rooms for all family members
Proof of monthly rent or ownership costs

assessmentCriteria.title: Business Permit Holders
requirements: Preliminary tax assessments from Swedish Tax Agency

assessmentCriteria.title: PhD Students and Researchers
requirements: Program duration generally longer than one year

assessmentCriteria.title: Permanent Residence Permit Holders
requirements: Long-term residence with strong ties to Sweden

assessmentCriteria.title: Refugees and Subsidiary Protection Holders
requirements: Maintenance requirement exemption possible within 3 months
Proof of relationship prior to arrival in Sweden

applicationProcess.title: Prepare Documentation
applicationProcess.description: Gather all required documents, including passports, proof of relationship (marriage or birth certificates), housing agreements, and income verification.

applicationProcess.title: Submit Application
applicationProcess.description: Submit applications online via the Swedish Migration Agency's portal or at a Swedish embassy/consulate, including proof of relationship and housing/income verification.

applicationProcess.title: Migration Agency Review
applicationProcess.description: The Swedish Migration Agency verifies all requirements are met, assessing income, housing, and family eligibility according to your specific permit type.

applicationProcess.title: Decision and Notification
applicationProcess.description: After assessment, the agency issues a decision. If approved, family members may receive residence permits matching the sponsor's permit duration.

legalProvisions.heading: Specific Legal Provisions
legalProvisions.description: Family reunification in Sweden is governed by specific legal provisions tailored to different permit types and family situations.

acts.name: Aliens Act (Utlänningslagen)
acts.details: Primary legal framework for family reunification, covering income, housing, and relationship verification with maintenance and housing standards.

acts.name: Temporary Aliens Act (Tillfälliga Utlänningslagen)
acts.details: Applies stricter maintenance requirements for refugees, emphasizing financial independence beyond the three-month application period.

acts.name: Social Insurance Code (Socialförsäkringsbalken)
acts.details: Defines acceptable sources of income, especially relevant for sponsors relying on benefits or unemployment.
